page.title: 15ELECTRICITY GRID STATION
page.content: This has long been a point of interest along Milords road between Fraddon and Scarcewater,an industrial looking complex set in rural Cornwall.It has been of interest to more than those who casually pass by.The grid station has controlled the supply of electricty to all who live and work in West and mid_Cornwall.During the war it was singled out for a bomb attack by the German bombers but they narrowly missed their target.It is a complex of transformers lowering the voltage from the main grid supply which is identified by the numerous steel pylons which converge on the station. Now the station is automatically controlled.Progress and increased electricity demands have resulted in a more modern station being built during the 1960's on the edge of Goss Moor.
